This Italian coffee maker is the perfect gift for friends, family, and anyone who loves flavorful Italian coffee.

☕️【Easy to Use Stove Top Coffee Maker】:This Stovetop Espresso Moka Pot can be heated on different devices including induction cooktop, ceramic stovetop, gas stove, and electric stove.Our espresso stove top coffee maker will company with you a long time.

☕️【Safe & Health】:Health and safety are our top concern, The heat-resistant handle is made of BPA free&Heat-resistant plastic, which provides full protection for your hands. The Italian Safety Valve in this stove top espresso coffee maker keeps you safe too.

☕️【Tips&Promise】:THE WATER LINE SHOULD NOT EXCEED THE SAFETY VALVE.Please stop heating the pot within one minute after the coffee is cooked to prevent burns to the bottom of the Moka coffee pot! If you receive any DEFECTIVE/UNSATISFIED Product,please contact us, we will try our best to help you and give you the best solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect espresso, glass top and stainless steel bottom, I love it!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I had a moka pot already but it was an aluminum one and I really wanted one that was stainless steel. This one is not only safer because it does not contain aluminum but it is also very pretty to look at. Super easy to use, perfect espresso everytime. It makes enough for about 3 shots I believe. Definitely worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best I have ever bought. Still awesome a year later
reviews.reviewText: Makes really good espresso. Well made.Makes a little under 1 cup of espresso for me following the instructions of filling to just below the pressure relief valve. It is not true that it makes more than one cup. However that one cup is good when using some good fresh ground bean. I can tap to compact the espresso grounds a bit and it handles that fine, and they way it waits until the pressure is good before letting the steam and hot water run through the grounds at the right temperature makes it phenomenal. I love that the top is glass so I can see hen it is done. The materials are great, stainless steel! I have bought a lot of stove top espresso makers over the years, this one is the very best! As long as you understand it is going to make a little less than one measured cup at a time, you will be happy with it. I use a little timer plug in stove top with it so I don’t have to worry about it sitting on the heat too long or forgetting it. That works really well for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic little machine!
reviews.reviewText: I love this coffee maker. Simple, easy to clean and makes a fab stove-top espresso. The clear top is the ringer. So fun to see the rich, dark coffee liquid rising up as it fills. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't buy this one. It has some serious flaws
reviews.reviewText: This worked well at first out of the box but within a couple weeks not so much. No I have to buy another model but this one is garbage. Even carefully limiting how much water it has, too much water leaks out the valve on the side and thus reduces the amount of water going through the grounds and up the tube to the top. Additionally, the extra valve on the top of the tube stem is a great idea but in practice it just creates a blockage that forces water and then steam out the valve on the side. This leads to only half a pot of coffee and a mess of water on the stove top. If you fiddle with that thing while it's cooking it helps -- but you should not have to stick a fork or spoon in there and it seems a little dangerous to do so. Finally, if it's not perfectly clean and perfectly threaded water and coffee leaks out through the threads. It's easy to keep clean but the threading is difficult to "feel" is perfect and if it's not perfect it just doesn't work at all. This thing is a good idea but a huge disappointment. I now have to buy another model and so would not recommend this one, though I wish I could

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Buy one with angles. Round=slippery
reviews.reviewText: Hard to open. Amazing taste and looks great. 5 stars if I could open it. I end up using the handle which you aren't supposed to do. I see another purchase in my future when I jack this one up. I still use it everyday so can't be that bad. I'm just complaining I guess

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The glass part is great because you can see when the coffee is done. I like it much more than the traditional metal pots.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stainless Steal for the Win!
reviews.reviewText: Got a traditional aluminum moka pot and it got moldy so fast. It would’ve been fine if I had the time to properly clean it with the right solution, since dish soap is a no-go. But with my hectic mornings, I don’t really have time for any cleaning that isn’t a quick rinse and pop in the dishwasher. This one is so easy to clean and so forgiving for busy, rushed mornings. Very easy to use and offers some excellent espresso!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love the look and it’s durable
reviews.reviewText: I bought this coffee maker over a year ago. I wanted to really give it a work out before posting a review. It has held up well. I like being able to see the coffee to know exactly when it’s finished. I recently gave this as a gift to a fussy teenager and it was a hit!
